abstract.text: Provide some common helper methods for building the image decoder/encoder.
Convert an EXIF image orientation to an iOS one.
Control the default limit bytes to scale down largest images.
This value must be larger than 4 Bytes (at least 1x1 pixel). Defaults to 60MB on iOS/tvOS, 90MB on macOS, 30MB on watchOS.
Check whether CGImage contains alpha channel.
Check whether CGImage is hardware supported to rendering on screen, without the trigger of
You can debug the copied image by using Xcode’s
, the copied image will turn Cyan and occupy double RAM for bitmap buffer.
Typically, when the CGImage’s using the method above (
) can render withtout the copy.
Tthis returns the pixel format

inlineContent.text: Preferred from current hardward && OS using runtime detection

abstract.text: For coders who use
, use the information below to create an effient CGImage which can be render on GPU without Core Animation’s extra copy (
), which can be debugged using
in Xcode Instruments
’s
params should use the information below.
Create a decoded CGImage by the provided CGImage. This follows The Create Rule and you are response to call release after usage.

It will detect whether image contains alpha channel, then create a new bitmap context with the same size of image, and draw it. This can ensure that the image do not need extra decoding after been set to the imageView.
Calculate the limited image size with the bytes, when using
. This preserve aspect ratio and never scale up
Create a scaled CGImage by the provided CGImage and size. This follows The Create Rule and you are response to call release after usage.
It will detect whether the image size matching the scale size, if not, stretch the image to the target size.
Control the default force decode solution. Available solutions  in
Provide some common helper methods for building the image decoder/encoder.
Check if the CGImage is using HDR color space.
Return frames array from an animated image.
For UIKit, this will unapply the patch for the description above and then create frames array. This will also work for normal animated UIImage.
For AppKit, NSImage does not support animates other than GIF. This will try to decode the GIF imageRep and then create frames array.
Return an animated image with frames array.
For UIKit, this will apply the patch and then create animated UIImage. The patch is because that
just use the average of duration for each image. So it will not work if different frame has different duration. Therefore we repeat the specify frame for specify times to let it work.

For AppKit, NSImage does not support animates other than GIF. This will try to encode the frames to GIF format and then create an animated NSImage for rendering. Attention the animated image may loss some detail if the input frames contain full alpha channel because GIF only supports 1 bit alpha channel. (For 1 pixel, either transparent or not)
Convert an iOS orientation to an EXIF image orientation.
Return the decoded and probably scaled down image by the provided image. If the image pixels bytes size large than the limit bytes, will try to scale down. Or just works as
, never scale up.
Detect whether the CGImage is lazy and not-yet decoded. (lazy means, only when the caller access the underlying bitmap buffer via provider like
or
, the decoder will allocate memory, it’s a lazy allocation)
The implementation use the Core Graphics internal to check whether the CGImage is
based, or
based. The
based is treated as non-lazy.
Return the decoded image by the provided image. This one unlike
, will not decode the image which contains alpha channel or animated image. On iOS 15+, this may use
to use CMPhoto for better performance than the old solution.
Scale the image size based on provided scale size, whether or not to preserve aspect ratio, whether or not to scale up.
Create a decoded CGImage by the provided CGImage and orientation. This follows The Create Rule and you are response to call release after usage.

It will detect whether image contains alpha channel, then create a new bitmap context with the same size of image, and draw it. This can ensure that the image do not need extra decoding after been set to the imageView.
Return the decoded and probably scaled down image by the provided image. If the image pixels bytes size large than the limit bytes, will try to scale down. Or just works as
, never scale up.
Return the decoded image by the provided image. This one unlike
, will not decode the image which contains alpha channel or animated image. On iOS 15+, this may use
to use CMPhoto for better performance than the old solution.
